issue.title: Communication between opendds and fastdds Opendds sent data Fastdds did not receive it
issue.body:
Hello, I have caught both normal and abnormal network packets from both parties. The data type analysis is the same, but Fastdds cannot receive the data，Look at the picture,This is the log captured by sending and replying to the compound medicine separately.
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/bc185217-2e8e-4bef-919b-31ace4b7a88e)
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/a10fe31c-91e4-4531-8a01-7cbadcc9a0ef)
I still don't understand a question, why does fastdds reply with a dimainid of 115 instead of 1.Next, we will upload the network package。
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/8aa85962-0936-4090-839a-8b61d1dfc808)

[log.zip](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/files/13038317/log.zip)

issue.title: Communication between opendds and fastdds Opendds sent data Fastdds did not receive it
issue.body:
Hello, I have caught both normal and abnormal network packets from both parties. The data type analysis is the same, but Fastdds cannot receive the data，Look at the picture,This is the log captured by sending and replying to the compound medicine separately.
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/bc185217-2e8e-4bef-919b-31ace4b7a88e)
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/a10fe31c-91e4-4531-8a01-7cbadcc9a0ef)
I still don't understand a question, why does fastdds reply with a dimainid of 115 instead of 1.Next, we will upload the network package。
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/8aa85962-0936-4090-839a-8b61d1dfc808)

[log.zip](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/files/13038317/log.zip)

comment.body:
> `@key`定义实例的键。双方必须就密钥达成一致。 消息 31 看起来像是实例注册消息。 请`register_instance`参阅 DDS 规范了解背景信息。

谢谢你的回复。

issue.title: Broken link for github discussions
issue.body: See https://opendds.org/faq.html#general-lists, link to github discussions isn't generated

pull_request.title: `InfoRepoDiscovery` does not use `ConfigStore`
pull_request.body:
Problem
-------
InfoRepoDiscovery does not use ConfigStore. See #4134.

Solution
--------
Convert InfoRepoDiscovery to use ConfigStore.

issue.title: Communication between opendds and fastdds Opendds sent data Fastdds did not receive it
issue.body:
Hello, I have caught both normal and abnormal network packets from both parties. The data type analysis is the same, but Fastdds cannot receive the data，Look at the picture,This is the log captured by sending and replying to the compound medicine separately.
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/bc185217-2e8e-4bef-919b-31ace4b7a88e)
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/a10fe31c-91e4-4531-8a01-7cbadcc9a0ef)
I still don't understand a question, why does fastdds reply with a dimainid of 115 instead of 1.Next, we will upload the network package。
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/8aa85962-0936-4090-839a-8b61d1dfc808)

[log.zip](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/files/13038317/log.zip)

comment.body:
`@key` defines the key of the instance.  Both sides must agree on the key.
Message 31 looks like an instance registration message.
See `register_instance` in the DDS spec for background.

issue.title: Communication between opendds and fastdds Opendds sent data Fastdds did not receive it
issue.body:
Hello, I have caught both normal and abnormal network packets from both parties. The data type analysis is the same, but Fastdds cannot receive the data，Look at the picture,This is the log captured by sending and replying to the compound medicine separately.
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/bc185217-2e8e-4bef-919b-31ace4b7a88e)

comment.body:
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/7d3edaa7-875f-4bc9-aeca-ace59f6f44d6)
I'm not sure what this data is and where it was sent. The application layer only called it once

issue.title: Communication between opendds and fastdds Opendds sent data Fastdds did not receive it
issue.body:
Hello, I have caught both normal and abnormal network packets from both parties. The data type analysis is the same, but Fastdds cannot receive the data，Look at the picture,This is the log captured by sending and replying to the compound medicine separately.
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/bc185217-2e8e-4bef-919b-31ace4b7a88e)
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/a10fe31c-91e4-4531-8a01-7cbadcc9a0ef)
I still don't understand a question, why does fastdds reply with a dimainid of 115 instead of 1.Next, we will upload the network package。
![image](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/assets/38304396/8aa85962-0936-4090-839a-8b61d1dfc808)

[log.zip](https://github.com/OpenDDS/OpenDDS/files/13038317/log.zip)

comment.body:
> 从抓包来看：
> 
> * 584 是来自 OpenDDS 编写器 010300557bb57df70d3accf8.00000002 的数据消息。序列号为15。
> * 588 是来自 010300557bb57df70d3accf8.00000002 的心跳，指向 010f4169a109d24d00000000.00000207，这是一个 eProsima - Fast-RTPS 阅读器。
> * 589 是序列号 15 的从 010f4169a109d24d00000000.00000207 到 010300557bb57df70d3accf8.00000002 的 ACK。
> 
> 从 RTPS 的角度来看，一切似乎都工作正常。如果 DCPS DataReader 未获取样本，则很可能是反序列化问题。检查读者期望的编码，然后配置 OpenDDS 以使用该编码。

Thank you for your reply. Currently, it seems that the problem is caused by the @ key keyword, but there may still be instances where Opendds sends incorrect data. It is unclear what caused the issue.

comment.body:
```suggestion
```

You can get rid of this and where it's mentioned. Input file paths are assumed to be relative to `CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR` most, if not all the time. We have it in the CMake tests because they're using source files located in a very different directories from the `CMakeLists.txt`.

pull_request.title: Add some tests to cmake
pull_request.body:
This PR is less about the particular test but I just wanted to work on getting something similar to the maps tests working in cmake. I split this off to keep the discussions focused.

The issue in the maps branch in the CI seems to be gtest, I'll see here if it's the same thing, and work on it

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.3...3.27)
+project(opendds_hello_world CXX)
+enable_testing()
+
+find_package(OpenDDS REQUIRED)
+include(opendds_testing)
+
+set(target_prefix "${PROJECT_NAME}_")
+
+# IDL TypeSupport Library
+set(idl "${target_prefix}idl")
+add_library(${idl})
+opendds_target_sources(${idl} PUBLIC "HelloWorld.idl")
+target_link_libraries(${idl} PUBLIC OpenDDS::Dcps)
+
+set(opendds_libs
+  OpenDDS::Dcps # Core OpenDDS Library
+  OpenDDS::InfoRepoDiscovery OpenDDS::Tcp # For run_test.pl
+  OpenDDS::Rtps OpenDDS::Rtps_Udp # For run_test.pl --rtps
+  ${idl}
+)
+
+# Publisher
+set(publisher "${target_prefix}publisher")
+add_executable(${publisher}
+  publisher.cpp
+)
+target_link_libraries(${publisher} ${opendds_libs})
+
+# Subscriber
+set(subscriber "${target_prefix}subscriber")
+add_executable(${subscriber}
+  subscriber.cpp
+)
+target_link_libraries(${subscriber} ${opendds_libs})
+
+# Testing
+configure_file(run_test.pl . COPYONLY)
+configure_file(rtps.ini . COPYONLY)
+opendds_add_test(NAME info_repo COMMAND perl run_test.pl)
+opendds_add_test(NAME rtps COMMAND perl run_test.pl --rtps)
comment.body:
Using RTPS is a bit different from the Messenger.

```suggestion
opendds_add_test(NAME rtps COMMAND perl run_test.pl ini=rtps.ini)
```

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.3...3.27)
+project(opendds_hello_world CXX)
+enable_testing()
+
+find_package(OpenDDS REQUIRED)
+include(opendds_testing)
+
+set(target_prefix "${PROJECT_NAME}_")
+
+# IDL TypeSupport Library
+set(idl "${target_prefix}idl")
+add_library(${idl})
+opendds_target_sources(${idl} PUBLIC "HelloWorld.idl")
+target_link_libraries(${idl} PUBLIC OpenDDS::Dcps)
+
+set(opendds_libs
+  OpenDDS::Dcps # Core OpenDDS Library
+  OpenDDS::InfoRepoDiscovery OpenDDS::Tcp # For run_test.pl
+  OpenDDS::Rtps OpenDDS::Rtps_Udp # For run_test.pl --rtps
+  ${idl}
+)
+
+# Publisher
+set(publisher "${target_prefix}publisher")
+add_executable(${publisher}
+  publisher.cpp
+)
+target_link_libraries(${publisher} ${opendds_libs})
+
+# Subscriber
+set(subscriber "${target_prefix}subscriber")
+add_executable(${subscriber}
+  subscriber.cpp
+)
+target_link_libraries(${subscriber} ${opendds_libs})
comment.body:
You'll have to set the `OUTPUT_NAME` target properties to `publisher` and `subscriber` to match how MPC builds them.

```suggestion
target_link_libraries(${publisher} ${opendds_libs})
set_target_properties(${publisher} PROPERTIES
  OUTPUT_NAME publisher
)

# Subscriber
set(subscriber "${target_prefix}subscriber")
add_executable(${subscriber}
  subscriber.cpp
)
target_link_libraries(${subscriber} ${opendds_libs})
set_target_properties(${subscriber} PROPERTIES
  OUTPUT_NAME subscriber
)
```

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.8...3.27)
+project(opendds_compiler_char_literals CXX)
+enable_testing()
+
+find_package(OpenDDS REQUIRED)
+include(opendds_testing)
+
+set(target_prefix "${PROJECT_NAME}_")
+set(src "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}")
+set(dst ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})
+set(opendds_libs
+  OpenDDS::Dcps
+)
+
+# IDL Library
+set(idl "${target_prefix}idl")
+add_library(${idl})
+opendds_target_sources(${idl} PUBLIC "${src}/test.idl" OPENDDS_IDL_OPTIONS "-Lc++11")
+target_link_libraries(${idl} PUBLIC OpenDDS::Dcps)
+set(idl_dir "${dst}")

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.8...3.27)
+project(opendds_compiler_char_literals CXX)
+enable_testing()
+
+find_package(OpenDDS REQUIRED)
+include(opendds_testing)
+
+set(target_prefix "${PROJECT_NAME}_")
+set(src "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}")
+set(dst ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})
+set(opendds_libs
+  OpenDDS::Dcps
+)
+
+# IDL Library
+set(idl "${target_prefix}idl")
+add_library(${idl})
+opendds_target_sources(${idl} PUBLIC "${src}/test.idl" OPENDDS_IDL_OPTIONS "-Lc++11")
+target_link_libraries(${idl} PUBLIC OpenDDS::Dcps)
+set(idl_dir "${dst}")
+set_target_properties(${idl} PROPERTIES
+  RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${idl_dir}"
+  LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${idl_dir}"
+)
+
+# Assert the mapping used was C++11
+get_property(mappings TARGET ${idl} PROPERTY OPENDDS_LANGUAGE_MAPPINGS)
+if(NOT ("C++11" IN_LIST mappings))
+  message(FATAL_ERROR "${idl}: C++11 NOT in mapping list: ${mappings}")
+endif()
+
comment.body:
This is something for testing that `opendds_target_sources` is setting `OPENDDS_LANGUAGE_MAPPINGS` correctly and not every test needs this.

```suggestion
```

This PR is less about the particular test but I just wanted to work on getting something similar to the maps tests working in cmake. I split this off to keep the discussions focused.

The issue in the maps branch in the CI seems to be gtest, I'll see here if it's the same thing, and work on it

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.8...3.27)
+project(opendds_compiler_char_literals CXX)
+enable_testing()
+
+find_package(OpenDDS REQUIRED)
+include(opendds_testing)
+
+set(target_prefix "${PROJECT_NAME}_")
+set(src "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}")
+set(dst ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})
+set(opendds_libs
+  OpenDDS::Dcps
+)
+
+# IDL Library
+set(idl "${target_prefix}idl")
+add_library(${idl})
+opendds_target_sources(${idl} PUBLIC "${src}/test.idl" OPENDDS_IDL_OPTIONS "-Lc++11")
+target_link_libraries(${idl} PUBLIC OpenDDS::Dcps)
+set(idl_dir "${dst}")
+set_target_properties(${idl} PROPERTIES
+  RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${idl_dir}"
+  LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${idl_dir}"
+)
+
+# Assert the mapping used was C++11
+get_property(mappings TARGET ${idl} PROPERTY OPENDDS_LANGUAGE_MAPPINGS)
+if(NOT ("C++11" IN_LIST mappings))
+  message(FATAL_ERROR "${idl}: C++11 NOT in mapping list: ${mappings}")
+endif()
+
+add_executable(opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe
+  "${src}/main.cpp"
+)
+set_target_properties(opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe PROPERTIES
+  RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${dst}"
+)
+target_link_libraries(opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe ${opendds_libs} ${idl} gtest)
+
+add_test(opendds_compiler_char_literals_test opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe)
comment.body:
It took a while to realize you didn't use `opendds_add_test`. It sets up the environment, like `PATH`/`LD_LIBRARY_PATH` correctly, which is why it can't find ACE/TAO libs. Ideally I'd more of what it does to be handled by the Perl test framework, but for now this is needed. It also is going to be better for testing for it to use `run_test.pl` instead of running the executable directly, though that means it has to conform to how it's built in MPC.

```suggestion
set_target_properties(opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe PROPERTIES
  OUTPUT_NAME char-literals-cpp11
  RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${dst}/cpp11"
)
target_link_libraries(opendds_compiler_char_literals_exe ${opendds_libs} ${idl} gtest)

configure_file(run_test.pl . COPYONLY)
opendds_add_test(COMMAND perl run_test.pl cpp11 EXTRA_LIB_DIRS "${idl_dir}")
```

pull_request.title: Add some tests to cmake
pull_request.body:
This PR is less about the particular test but I just wanted to work on getting something similar to the maps tests working in cmake. I split this off to keep the discussions focused.

The issue in the maps branch in the CI seems to be gtest, I'll see here if it's the same thing, and work on it

repo.name: OpenDDS
repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

repo.description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS also supports Java bindings through JNI.

commits.message:
Fixes for Release Script and Doc Post-3.26.0

- Fixed Read the Docs links in README not getting updated properly.
- Fixed `gitrelease.pl --list` ignoring the current release workspace.
  This comes at the cost of having to have that workspace though.
- Re-enabled Read the Docs version activation and updated release doc
  for this.
- Other small fixes for the release doc.

Merge pull request #4322 from iguessthislldo/igtd/release-script-3.26

Fixes for Release Script and Doc Post-3.26.0

pull_request.title: Fixes for Release Script and Doc Post-3.26.0
pull_request.body:
- Fixed Read the Docs links in README not getting updated properly.
- Fixed `gitrelease.pl --list` ignoring the current release workspace. This comes at the cost of having to have that workspace though.
- Re-enabled Read the Docs version activation and updated release doc for this.
- Other small fixes for the release doc.

repo.name: OpenDDS
